c74object.name: the.mc.sftranslate~
c74object.digest: Translate between multichannel and mono singlechannel sound files
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â©2022, www.xenorama.com.
Create multipe singlechannel sound files from a multichannel soundfile on disk, or compile multiple mono soundfiles into a multichannel soundfile. Useful for preparing media check files for various speakers or for compiling multichannel files for tidy playback in Max.

attribute.name: auto_path
attribute.digest: Always save files to source folder
attribute.description: Always save files to source folder. The default is "1" (save to source folder).

attribute.name: derive_name
attribute.description:
Derive filename from source files. Splitting files will use the name of the single source file, merging multiple files will use all leading strings that match among them. For detailed control see the filename listing.
This feture is disabled by default.

attribute.name: dither
attribute.description: Enable triangular dithering when writing PCM (integer) files.

enum.name: Off
enum.digest: Apply no dithering when writing PCM files

enum.name: Dither
enum.digest: Apply triangular dither (TPDF) when writing PCM files

enum.name: Dither + Noise Shaping
enum.digest: Apply triangular dither with noise shaping (HP-TPDF) when writing PCM files

attribute.name: filetype
attribute.description: The audio file format used by the buffer~ object. The default file type is WAVE.

attribute.name: format
attribute.description:
The bit depth or sample type of the buffer on disk
For backward compatibility, the following numeric valus can be used to set format, in addition to the symbolic names below:
8 - 8-bit integer
16 - 16-bit integer
24 - 24-bit integer
32 - 32-bit integer

attribute.name: filename
attribute.description: Set filename for resulting files. Splitting multichannel files will result in single files with the given name and trailing indices.

attribute.name: labels
attribute.description:
When creating multiple mono sound files from a multichannel sound file, the label setting can provide a list of names which the resulting sound files will assume after the numerical index corresponding to their channel index. Lists of names longer than the number of channels will be truncated, shorter lists will be wrapped around.
For example the specification @labels left center right will append those labels to the filenames of the mono files in channels 1, 2 and 3, respectievly.
Without any arguments, this setting is ignored.

attribute.name: normalize
attribute.description: When set to non-zero, will normalize multichannel sound files to the specified amplitude. When compiling sound files to multichannel, this will be performed after compilation on the final file, when splitting sound files, this is performed on the original multichannel file before splitting. The default is "0" (inherit original amplitude).

attribute.name: quantization
attribute.description: Select the quantization rule when writing PCM (integer) files.

enum.name: Round
enum.digest: Round when quantizing to integer values.

enum.name: Floor
enum.digest: Floor when quantizing to integer values.

attribute.name: resize
attribute.description: Specify how many channels to compile or split into. When set to "0" (default), the resulting number of channels will match the original channelcount. See also the select listing for mapping desired channels.

attribute.name: section
attribute.digest: Set beginning and length of audiofile section
attribute.description:
Set beginning and length of audiofile section. Expects two integers or floating-points values representing a beginning and length in miliseconds. Subsequent readfolder or split methods will craete audiofiles as sections of source file.
The message "section" without any arguments uses entire length of source audiofiles.

attribute.name: select
attribute.description:
Specify which channels to compile or split into. As per mc-wrapper, mappings start at "1". Note that this setting does not override the resize listing, which, if set to non-zero, will specify how many channels are being compiled/split.
When set to "0", the original channelmap is maintained.

attribute.name: sr
attribute.description: Set sampling rate of files to be written. The default is 48000 (48kHz).

method.name: bang
method.description: Re-apply the previous command on the previously provided sound file or path.

method.name: collect
method.digest: Merge audio files from different directories
method.description: Merge audio files from different directories. Expects a list of valid paths to audio files. Audio files of different lengths will all be aligned at the beginning of the file(s) with shorter files being subsequently filled with silence in their respective channel.

method.name: readfolder
method.description: Read a folder and compile all found sound files into a single multichannel sound file on disk. The user will be prompted to specify a path and filename for the resulting file.

method.name: split
method.description: Provide a valid path to a multichannel or stereo file. To the same directory, a specified number of mono files will be written from this file.
